articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects May Day Stadium
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects May Day Stadium
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, inspected the May Day Stadium to give tasks to remodel it.
					 He went round the room devoted to the history of the stadium and the room housing revolutionary relics. 
					
					 He said that the May Day Stadium opened on May 1, 1989 in the presence of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il is associated with the undying feats performed by them for the development of the Juche-oriented sports. 
					
					 He saw with deep emotion photos of Kim Il Sung making a congratulatory speech at the opening ceremony of the 13th World Festival of Youth and Students and Kim Jong Il going round the stadium. He called for remodeling the stadium into an all-event stadium to be proud of in the world so as to glorify the leadership exploits of the Generalissimos down through generations. 
					
					 He went round spectators' seats, track, football field and other places of the stadium. 
					
					 The May Day Stadium is a very huge stadium with a large seating capacity, he said, stressing the need to install new attractive stools to the spectators' convenience in order to radically change the appearance of their seats.
					
					 He instructed officials to provide the track in the field of the stadium with rubber mat and the football field with artificial turf in line with the international standard and install lighting facilities in such a way as to host any match.
					
					 He went round indoor training rooms and rest rooms for players and spectators, etc. of the stadium.
					
					 He said it is the determination of the Party to successfully remodel the May Day Stadium into an icon of sports facilities in the country and into a stadium befitting the appearance of the highly civilized nation.
					
					 Noting that to remodel the stadium is an important work for further developing the Juche-oriented sports amid the ever-growing zeal for sports and demonstrating the national power and a high level of civilization, he specified tasks and ways to do so.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA; Jang Song Thaek, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC; Ro Tu Chol, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet; Ri Yong Su, department director of the C.C., the WPK; Pak Thae Song and Ma Won Chun, vice department directors of the C.C., the WPK; Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports; and officials concerned.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets WCC Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets WCC Delegation
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday met and had a talk with the delegation of the World Council of Churches (WCC) led by General Secretary Olav Fykse Tveit who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Guinea-Bissau
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Guinea-Bissau
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Manuel Sirifo N'hamadjo, president of Guinea-Bissau, on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the proclamation of its republic.
					 Kim in the message expressed conviction that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow strong, wishing the president success in his work and the country prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations to Australian PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Australian PM
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Monday sent a congratulatory message to Anthony John Abbott upon his assumption of office as prime minister of Australia. 
					 The message expressed expectation and belief that the relations between the two countries would develop on good terms on the principle of respect for sovereignty, equality and mutual benefits and wished the prime minister success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Congratulations to Senegalese PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Senegalese PM
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju on Sept. 21 sent a congratulatory message to Aminata Toure upon her appointment as prime minister of Senegal.
					 The message expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger and sincerely wished her success in her responsible work for the development of the country and the well-being of the people.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun also sent a similar message to Mankeur Ndiaye upon his reappointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and Overseas Senegalese on the same day.

articles.title: Congratulations to Malian PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Malian PM
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Oumar Tama LY upon his appointment as prime minister of Mali.
					 The message expressed belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow strong, wishing the prime minister of Mali success in his responsible work for the national unity and socio-economic development of the country.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to Zahabi Ould Sidi Mojamed upon his appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Mali on the same day.

articles.title: Congratulations to Zimbabwean FM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Zimbabwean FM
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Simbarashe Simbanenduku Mumbengegwi upon his reappointment as foreign minister of Zimbabwe.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries with a long historical tradition would grow stronger in all fields of politics, economy and culture, wishing the foreign minister greater success in his work for the development of external relations of the country.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from WCC General Secretary
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from WCC General Secretary
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the visiting general secretary of the World Council of Churches.
					 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, by Olav Fykse Tveit, general secretary of the WCC, on Tuesday.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Oman Sultan
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Oman Sultan
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, on Sept. 5 received a message of greeting from Qaboos Bin Said, sultan of Oman.
					 The sultan said he was happy to extend sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly people of the DPRK steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from King of Bahrain
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from King of Bahrain
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, on Sept. 8 received a message of greeting from Sheikh Hamad Bin Isa al-Khalifa, king of Bahrain.
					 The king in the message extended sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un on his own behalf and on behalf of all the people of Bahrain on the occasion of the anniversary of the DPRK, the national holiday.
					
					 The message sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the people of the DPRK steady progress and prosperity under his wise leadership.

articles.title: DPRK PM Visits 9th Pyongyang Autumn Int'l Trade Fair
articles.content:
DPRK PM Visits 9th Pyongyang Autumn Int'l Trade Fair
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Tuesday visited the 9th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair.
					 Displayed in the fair are metal, electronic, chemical and light industrial goods, machinery, foodstuffs and consumer goods presented by companies of some countries including the DPRK, Germany, Russia, Malaysia, Mongolia, Singapore, Italy, China, Cuba, Turkey and Taipei of China and regions.
					
					 Seeing CNC lathes, automobiles, tractors, a variety of tiles and other goods produced by technicians and workers of the DPRK and exhibits presented by different countries and regions, the premier underscored the need to produce more goods of world competitive edge and popular among people.
					
					 He stressed that the trade fair would serve as a good opportunity for promoting friendship and unity among countries and expanding wide-ranging and many-sided economic trade dealings, introduction of goods and exchange of science and technology.

articles.title: Pyongyang Autumn Int'l Trade Fair
articles.content:
Pyongyang Autumn Int'l Trade Fair
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The 9th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair is going on at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House here from Monday.
					 According to Pak Ung Sik, president of the Korean International Exhibition Corporation, the fair offers a good opportunity in promoting friendship and solidarity among countries and providing many-sided economic transactions, commodity presentation and sci-tech exchange.
					
					 Taking part in it are more than 220 trading companies from 10-odd countries and regions, mostly from Beijing, Dandong, Dalian, Shenyang and other areas of China.
					
					 Popov Sergey, commercial director of Russia's Maritime Territory Confectionary Company, told KCNA that he hoped for strengthened economic cooperation between the DPRK and Russia, expecting products of his company to be favored by Korean people.
					
					 Juana Navarrete Mendoza, a section chief of Cuba's LABIOFAM Enterprise Group, said it was honor for them to attend the excellent fair with main products of the Group.
					
					On display at the fair are more than 57,000 products of 2,400-odd kinds, including machinery, electric and electronic appliances, light industrial goods, foodstuffs, medical instruments, medicines, building materials, chemicals and vehicles.

articles.title: Table Tennis Team Events Close
articles.content:
Table Tennis Team Events Close
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Men and women's team events of the 27th Pyongyang International Invitation Table Tennis Tournament took place on Monday and Tuesday.
					 The results of the events are as follows:
					
					 Men's
					
					 First:     DPRK (group A)
						 Second:  DPRK (group B)
						 Third:    China
					
					 Women's
					
					 First:     DPRK (group A)
						 Second: DPRK (group B)
						 Third:    China
					
					 The tournament goes on.

articles.title: 32nd Yun I Sang Concert Opens
articles.content:
32nd Yun I Sang Concert Opens
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The 32nd Yun I Sang concert was opened.
					 An opening concert was given at the Yun I Sang Concert Hall on Tuesday.
					
					 Among the audience were Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture, Kim Ho Yun, director of the Yun I Sang Music Institute, officials concerned, creators, artistes, teachers and students in the fields of stage art and art education, Pyongyangites and overseas compatriots.
					
					 Vice-Minister of Culture Han Chol made an address.
					
					 The Orchestra of the Yun I Sang Music Institute put on the stage such numbers as "Yungdan" for stringed instruments.
					
					 The concert was highly acclaimed by the audience for its successful representation of the themes of music pieces through refined rendition.
					
					 The concert will last till Thursday.

articles.title: Power Production Grows in DPRK
articles.content:
Power Production Grows in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Power production is nowadays increasing at the hydro-power stations of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Thaechon Power Station No. 5 is carrying out its daily quota at 130 percent, keeping generating equipment at full-capacity operation. It introduced a new type of field current restrictor into its generators while properly managing hydraulic structures.
					
					 The Hochongang Power Station has raised its turnout 1.3 times as compared with the same period of last year.
					
					 Its Station No. 3 is fulfilling its daily plan at over 110 percent by strictly observing the technical rules and standard regulations in operation of equipment, while Station No. 4 operates its equipment at full capacity, keeping them in good condition and preparing enough spare parts. Station Nos. 2, 5 and 6, too, are increasing their output through a socialist emulation drive for increased production.
					
					 Pujongang Power Station Nos. 2 and 3 have improved generating equipment to lay a solid foundation for raising efficiency of generators while regulating load on a rational way according to the features of generators.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers' Anti-DPRK Maneuvers Get Frantic: News Analyst
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers' Anti-DPRK Maneuvers Get Frantic: News Analyst
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The north-south relations which had advanced toward reconciliation and cooperation thanks to the broad-minded and positive efforts of the DPRK have again faced the phase of confrontation and tensions.
					 The south Korean puppet warmongers have resorted to dangerous war moves against the DPRK though an agreement on bringing operations in the Kaesong Industrial Zone to normal was adopted and the issues such as reunion of separated families and their relatives and the resumption of the suspended tour of Mt. Kumgang progressed. They staged the large-scale Ulji Freedom Guardian joint war military exercises targeting the DPRK from August 19 in league with the U.S. under the pretext of "annual drills". 
					
					 On August 22 when the joint military exercises were in the height, Hukryong Unit of the puppet Marine Corps got frantic with the north-targeted war maneuvers around five islands in the West Sea of Korea, claiming that it will cope with firepower provocation, infiltration and surprise occupation by the north.
					
					 The 17th Infantry Division of the puppet Army held combined anti-terrorism drills in Inchon and Puchon on August 20 and 21.
					
					 Never a day has passed since August without war maneuvers, notably a drill for urgent provision of munitions to a unit of the puppet forces in Phaju, Kyonggi Province from Kwangju City and combined anti-infiltration drill by the 23rd Infantry Division of the puppet Army in Samchok, south Korean Kangwon Province and Uljin, North Kyongsang Province.
					
					 One more typical example is the burlesque for confrontation with the DPRK staged in Inchon on September 15.
					
					 That day there staged a farce for repeating the landing operation in Inchon committed by the U.S. imperialists during the June 25 Korean War with huge forces including the U.S. forces and south Korean navy and marine corps, at least 10 warships, more than 20 planes and over 20 armored cars involved.
					
					 The south Korean conservative regime has gone more desperate than ever before to beef up armed forces to invade the DPRK.
					
					 The warmongers are continuing stepping up the purchase of fighters from the U.S. and trying to introduce from overseas refueling tankers to drastically increase the operating hours of F-15K and KF-16 fighters.
					
					 Latest mine-cleaning tanks have been deployed for the U.S. forces present in south Korea and the ground air reconnoitering unit equipped with 30 OH-58Ds will join the U.S. forces based in Phyongthaek.
					
					 The warmongers deployed mobile maritime monitoring radars on five islands in the West Sea of Korea and are squandering a large amount of money for the development and introduction of war hardware including the test of launching torpedo from submarine and the building of submarine with vertical launcher.
					
					 Traitor Kim Kwan Jin, minister of Defense, told the military recently that they should firmly keep the combat posture though the phase of south-north dialogue is open, revealing the attempt to confront with the DPRK to the last.
					
					 Not content with describing a recent series of progresses made in the inter-Korean relations as the fruition of their "theory of principle", the warmongers are countering the just steps and warnings of the DPRK with "decisive countermeasure" and "international sanctions and resolute retaliation". This is a shameless act aimed to evade their responsibility for the present grave situation.

articles.title: Theory of "Missile Threat from N. Korea" Is Product of New Cold War Strategy: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Theory of "Missile Threat from N. Korea" Is Product of New Cold War Strategy: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is putting spurs to the establishment of missile defense system in the Asia-Pacific.
					 As part of this move it recently staged again interceptor missile tests on an island of Marshallese and the area near it.
					
					 The U.S. is claiming that the tests were to cope with "missile threat from north Korea" but no one will believe it.
					
					 This was apparently prompted by its design to contain China and Russia, nuclear powers in the Asia-Pacific, and maintain and strengthen its military supremacy.
					
					 The tests arouse greater concern of Asian countries as they were conducted after the deployment of a new missile shield on Guam.
					
					 The U.S. escalated moves for missile shield provoke serious backlash and prompt vigilance against the outbreak of the new Cold War in the region.
					
					 This is a dangerous move that may spark off new stand-off and arms race not only in the region but the rest of the world in the future.
					
					 Historically, theories of "threats" raised by the U.S. were no more than excuses to justify its aggression and interference in the internal affairs of other countries.
					
					 After the Second World War the U.S. persistently pursued the Cold War strategy relying on anti-Soviet Union and anti-communist forces under the pretext of holding back the "threat of spread of communism."
					
					 After the Cold War the U.S. cried out for a uni-polar world, boasting of being the world's only superpower. Later, it launched the "war on terrorism" while resorting to highhanded and arbitrary practices under the signboard of "threat of terrorism."
					
					 The arrogant U.S. got increasingly crippled, being saddled with enormous state debt, troubled with economic decline and mired in "anti-terrorism war" while the Asia-Pacific rapidly rose as a center of world development in the 21st century.
					
					 Upset by the rise of the region, home to a half of the world population and nuclear and economic powers and newly-emerging economies with rich natural resources and markets, the U.S. raised the pivot to Asia-Pacific strategy.
					
					 To carry out its strategy for world supremacy the U.S. again designated its rivals and "states posing threat to it" as in the period of Cold War and grappled with forming an encirclement ring.
					
					 It mounted pressure offensive while covertly using the phrase of "potential rival" by taking into consideration the failed uni-polar world strategy, changed structure of forces caused by the world trend of multipolarization and international rebuff.
					
					 The "potential rival" designated by the U.S. meant China rapidly emerging as an economic power in Asia and Russia which retook its position as power.
					
					 In order to establish the U.S.-led domination order in the Asia-Pacific and take control of the world by containing the two big powers the U.S. is pushing ahead with the formation of big missile shield covering vast areas from Alaska to Australia through south Korea, Japan and the Philippines.
					
					 The U.S. insists that the tests were to "provide against the missile development of north Korea", not meant to target the powers in surrounding areas. But this is a base deception of the international community.
					
					 The Washington Post disclosed the fact that the CIA defined already in the 1990s China and Russia as "potential rivals" that can challenge the U.S. interests and put the DPRK and Iran on the list of "states posing threat to the U.S." in a bid to secure the pretext for establishing the missile shield in Asia.
					
					 Victor Yesin, former chief of the General Staff of the Strategic Rocket Forces of Russia, said that U.S. response to the DPRK is asymmetric, adding the former is establishing the theatre missile defense system to deter nuclear potentials of China and Russia.
					
					 The U.S. schemes to put military pressure on those countries through new missile shield and inveigle them into new arms race so that they may use up their national capabilities and plunge into an economic turmoil.
					
					 As seen above, the U.S. theory of "missile threat from north Korea" is no more than sophism to cover up its criminal nature as it is a product of its new strategy for world supremacy, Cold War strategy of the Asian version.
					
					 The U.S. should never be allowed to turn the Asia-Pacific into a springboard for world domination and theater of new Cold War as the countries in the region aspire after peace and development.
					
					 The anachronistic attempt of the U.S. is bound to fail.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Frustrating Imperialists' Ideological and Cultural Poisoning
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Frustrating Imperialists' Ideological and Cultural Poisoning
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article calls on the countries and people aspiring after the independent development and social progress to have clear understanding of the danger and aftereffects of the imperialists' bourgeois ideological and cultural poisoning and nip it in its bud.
					 Dignity of nations is being mercilessly violated and development of their economy is disturbed in some countries and regions, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Such abnormal situation is ascribable to the fact that those countries didn't stand resolutely against the imperialists' ideological and cultural poisoning as they failed to keep strict vigilance over it.
					
					 The imperialists have desperately worked to disseminate bourgeois ideology and culture as a single criterion. This is aimed to create illusions about them and dominate other countries at will by letting their idea and culture prevail in the world. This is an ulterior design reflected in "freedom" of idea and culture touted by them.
					
					 The imperialists are abusing the "freedom" of idea and culture as a pretext to deliberately interfere in the internal affairs of other countries and violate and infringe upon their state sovereignty.
					
					 They are accusing the countries not tolerating bourgeois idea and culture of violating "human rights". This smear campaign is a prelude to invasion, as evidenced by the situation in some Mideast countries in recent years.
					
					 Now the main target of the imperialists' ideological and cultural poisoning is the anti-imperialist independent countries and those with rich natural resources or in strategic vantage points.
					
					 Openly trumpeting they can easily topple with bourgeois idea and culture even those countries they find it hard to bring down with nuclear weapons, the imperialists are staging vicious campaign to disseminate their corrupt idea and culture. 
					
					 The situation calls on all countries to totally reject the imperialists' bourgeois ideological and cultural poisoning and wage strenuous actions against it.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Anti-DPRK Remarks under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Anti-DPRK Remarks under Fire
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet Ministry of Unification in a "statement to the north" expressed "regret", claiming as if it did something for mending inter-Korean relations. It went the lengths of crying out for "international sanctions and resolute retaliation", deliberately finding fault with the just steps taken by the DPRK as "acts against humanity".
					 Papers Tuesday say in commentaries in this regard:
					
					 This is a shameless act just like a thief crying "stop the thief", a very dishonest move to divert the public attention away from the present situation and realize the attempt at confrontation with the DPRK at any cost.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun notes:
					
					 The south Korean regime is a very heinous criminal violating human ethics and humanitarianism as it disrupted the reunion of separated families and their relatives through anti-DPRK smear campaign and confrontation with fellow countrymen, far from valuing the hard-won atmosphere for improving inter-Korean relations.
					
					 Those insulting humanitarianism, to say nothing of human ethics, are taking issue with the DPRK over "humanity". It is like a guilty party filing the suit first.
					
					 We cannot but take a serious note of the fact that south Korean conservative media and riff-raffs styling themselves "experts on the north" are beautifying the conservative authorities' "theory of principle" against reunification, seriously slandering and insulting the DPRK and encouraging the ruling forces to "adhere to principle", unhesitatingly chilling the atmosphere for mending inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The present tragic state of the inter-Korean relations is ascribable to the obstructions by the conservative media and pseudo experts engrossed in agitation for confrontation.
					
					 The DPRK will never tolerate the confrontation racket hurting its dignity and self-esteem in the future, either.
					
					 Minju Joson urges the south Korean regime to throw away daggers kept in its belt and apologize before the nation for the present grave situation, clearly aware that the DPRK's warnings are not an empty talk.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Rhetoric about "Results of Theory of Principle" Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Rhetoric about "Results of Theory of Principle" Slammed
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration issued a statement on Tuesday.
					 It said:
					
					 The south Korean puppet conservative regime now describes the recent atmosphere of improving the inter-Korean relations as the "results of its theory of principle". This is self-centered remarks bereft of elementary common sense about the inter-Korean relations and devoid of discernment.
					
					 The north and the south could achieve an epochal shift to the new era of reconciliation and cooperation after ending the history of distrust and confrontation that lasted more than half a century since the nation's division. This was entirely thanks to the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 An atmosphere of improvement created between the north and the south in recent days is grounded on firm foundation.
					
					 This is, in fact, the process for restoring the June 15 era by the positive efforts of the DPRK and a precious result made by all the Koreans through their efforts to implement the north-south joint declarations.
					
					 Gatherings for the country's reunification including the joint national meeting for marking the 13th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration broke down by the puppet conservative group. The nightmare of "yusin" dictatorship is being revived in south Korea. Therefore, the pro-reunification patriots were mercilessly punished being charged as "forces following the north" and "pro-north forces". This is a reality in south Korea.
					
					 The puppet regime is making efforts to advertise the "actual results of the policy toward the north" in a bid to tide over the protests of the people from all walks of life against the restoration of notorious "yusin" dictatorship and unpopular rule. But, no one will be taken in by such poor assertion.
					
					 The more loudly the south Korean authorities and vicious and dirty hack conservative media trumpet about the "theory of principle" while resorting to the "confrontation accompanied with dialogue", the closer the inter-Korean relations will inch to the dangerous phase.
					
					 All the Koreans at home and abroad should resolutely reject and denounce the acts of treachery going against humanity on the part of the puppet regime, which chilled the hard-won atmosphere of dialogue and pushed the situation to the dangerous catastrophe again, and turn out in the righteous actions to thoroughly preserve and implement the north-south joint declarations.

articles.title: Damage by Pine Nematode Increases in S. Korea
articles.content:
Damage by Pine Nematode Increases in S. Korea
Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Damage by the Bursaphelenchus lignicolus now expands in south Korea, arousing big concern.
					It is reported that the nematode infiltrates into the tree, cuts the passage of water and nutrients and excretes toxin, thus killing the tree in the end. The disease has so far swept 80 regions of south Korea since it first broke out in Pusan in 1988.
					
					Pine trees that were blighted have increased each year, reaching 132,000 in 2010 and 506,000 in 2012.
					
					This year, too, the disease was reported in regions including Kaphyong, Yangju and Ansong in Kyonggi Province with at least 300,000 pine trees being blighted and the damage rapidly expanding.

articles.title: DPRK's "Speed on Masik Pass" Introduced in Brazil
articles.content:
DPRK's "Speed on Masik Pass" Introduced in Brazil
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK posted on its internet website an article titled "'Speed on Masik Pass'" on September 19. 
					 The article said the DPRK is vigorously advancing at the "speed on Masik Pass", introducing the construction project of the ski resort. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 It was supreme leader Kim Jong Un who initiated the construction of the ski resort in the area of Masik Pass. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un entrusted the Korean People's Army with the task to build a ski resort on Masik Pass to be proud of in the world. 
					
					 In hearty response to his order, soldier-builders paved ski courses for beginners, amateurs and professional skiers in a matter of less than a year since they broke the ground on steep mountain ranges. The total length of the ski courses are nearly 110 000 meters and they cover hundreds of thousands of square meters with their widths ranging from 40 to 120 meters. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un highly appreciated the labor feats of soldier-builders when he visited the construction site at the end of May. He gave the tasks and ways for hastening the construction. 
					
					 Afterwards he sent an appeal calling for finishing the construction within this year by creating the "speed on Masik Pass". 
					
					 His appeal brought about fresh miracles and innovations in the construction site. 
					
					 A world-level ski resort will take its amazing shape on Masik Pass before long. 
					
					 Miracles and innovations are being made on a daily basis in the DPRK amid the flame of creating the "speed on Masik Pass".

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Foreign magazines and newspaper carried special write-ups to mark the 65th anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 The September issue of the Chinese Hong Kong magazine International Link carried several articles with photos of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 In an article titled "People uphold him as sun" the magazine said that the Korean people are blessed with the sun as they are led by Kim Jong Un who is identical to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Un declared that the way to be followed by the DPRK is the way of independence, Songun and socialism. 
					
					 Visiting every nook and corner of the country he gives detailed orientations and ways for providing the people with rich and prosperous life under socialism as early as possible. 
					
					 The Korean people upholding Kim Jong Un as the sun are confidently advancing for the day when they will enjoy wealth and prosperity under socialism. 
					
					 The September issue of a Vietnamese magazine carried an article titled "Vigorously advancing country" with the photo of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 It said:
					
					 It is the goal of the Korean people to achieve national reunification and build a thriving nation under the banner of the Juche idea created by Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un who carries forward the cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il is wisely leading the Korean revolution. 
					
					 Under the leadership of Kim Jong Un the Korean people will surely build an economic power and achieve national reunification. 
					
					 The British newspaper The New Worker on Sept. 13 carried an article titled "65 year-long history of struggle".

articles.title: DPRK Anniversary Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK Anniversary Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The 65th anniversary of the DPRK was marked with various events in foreign countries from Sept. 7 to 14.
					 The events included a Kimjongilia exhibition at Yuwen Middle School in Jilin of China, meetings in Sankt-Peterburg of Russia and in Minsk of Belarus and lectures at the faculty of fine arts in Guinean Art College and at a construction site in Conakry City in Guinea.
					
					 The chairman of the All-Russian Society for the Study and Dissemination of Kimilsungism, the chairwoman of the Kim Jong Suk Women's Union of Russia and other speakers praised President Kim Il Sung for his state-building exploits. They said he founded the Democratic People's Republic of Korea after the country's liberation on the basis of the precious experience gained in building the people's government during his anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, and turned the country into a socialist power--independent, self-supporting and self-defensive.
					
					 The chairman of the February 16 Belarus Youth Association for the Study of Juche Idea and Songun Politics admired the DPRK for covering the victorious and glorious path and achieving complete independence of the popular masses.
					
					 The rector of Guinean Art College said the cause of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il has been reliably inherited by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Korean people will enjoy victory and glory advancing towards the rosy future under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, he added.
					
					 A message of greeting to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting in Russia.

articles.title: Korean Book, Photo and Fine Art Exhibitions Held Abroad
articles.content:
Korean Book, Photo and Fine Art Exhibitions Held Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Korean book, photo and fine art exhibitions took place in foreign countries from Sept. 3 to 16 to mark the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They were held in Kaluga Region of Russia, Minsk City of Belarus, Vilcea County of Romania, Djakarta City of Indonesia, Sao Paulo State of Brazil and Mexico City of Mexico.
					
					 A vice mayor of Obninsk City in Kaluga Region of Russia said President Kim Il Sung built a genuine people's country on the land of Korea 65 years ago and developed it into a prosperous socialist power.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il held high the banner of Songun to meet all the challenges by the imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK and fortified the country, he said, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK has kept to the path of socialism under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un and achieved great successes in building a thriving nation despite the disturbances by the hostile forces. The Russians are happy to witness the successes.
					
					 A secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Belarus wished the Koreans keeping to socialism united close around Kim Jong Un victory and prosperity.
					
					 A vice-chancellor of Jakarta National University said the Indonesia-DPRK relations are long-standing and very close as they were provided by President Sukarno and President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The international secretary of the Brazilian Communist Party praised Kim Il Sung as the founder of socialist Korea, adding: He defeated the Japanese imperialists and founded the DPRK on Sept. 9, 1948.
					
					 The DPRK has turned into a socialist country--independent, self-supporting and self-defensive--and now displays its might.

articles.title: Magazine Paektu-Halla Issued
articles.content:
Magazine Paektu-Halla Issued
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China released the September issue of its magazine Paektu-Halla.
					 Carried in the magazine is a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un making a concluding speech at the enlarged meeting of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 It carries Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution".
					
					 Given in the magazine are articles titled "On days of founding the republic", "The DPRK is popular and independent country" and a poem "Flutter, flag of the DPRK" on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 Also carried there are articles titled "General and CNC (13), 'higher and faster'", "Country of eternal war victory", "My country is charming everywhere" and "The DPRK-China friendship sealed in blood is eternal".
					
					 It carries the news that the General Association of Koreans in China held round-table talks and that Korean war veterans in China who participated in the celebrations of the 65th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War held round-table talks in various places of China.
					
					 Seen in the magazine is a statement issued by the spokesman for the Policy Department of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK "The U.S. and the south Korean authorities should clearly face up to the trend of the times and think twice."
					
					 Also given there is news of the struggle being conducted by south Korean people and overseas compatriots to condemn the illegal interference in the election by the south Korean Intelligence Service and demand the probe into the truth and the punishment of those related.
					
					 It also carries international and other news.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre campo de construccion del Hospital de Estomatologia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre campo de construccion del Hospital de Estomatologia
Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio el campo de construccion del Hospital de Estomatologia en etapa final.
					Le acompanaron el jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Han Kwang Sang, y los subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak Thae Song, Ma Won Chun y Ho Hwan Chol.
					
					En su recorrido por el lugar, averiguo en detalles como marcha la construccion y los problemas surgidos.
					
					Primero, estuvo en el primer piso del hospital en que estan distribuidos el hall central y el de conexion, las salas de primeros auxilios y de preparacion de materiales, la farmacia, la tienda, etc.
					
					Recorriendo los halles, se mostro contento del plan de asegurar la clara y suave iluminacion interior e instruyo amueblarlos bien.
					
					En la sala de primeros auxilios, se puso muy complacido de que los enfermos de urgencia pudieran recibir en ella el tratamiento estomatologico en cualquier momento.
					
					En el segundo piso, el Mariscal recorrio las salas de cirugia, medicina interna y pediatria, etc.
					
					Averiguo concretamente la obra de acabado del interior en cada una de esas salas y subrayo que el PTC preparo 30 sillones de dentista de uso universal con los que pueden tratar al dia a mas de 300 pacientes.
					
					Reitero que deben adornar las salas de terapia, los pasillos y los halles con buenos materiales de acabado segun el diseno aprobado ya.
					
					En el sitio de juego para los ninos que se acondiciona en el hall del segundo piso, senalo que eso les gustaria mucho a los padres que vendran con sus hijos e instruyo terminarlo bien conforme a la psicologia infantil.
					
					Subio al tercer piso donde paso por la sala de reunion, las oficinas y otras habitaciones y enseno que deben decorar bien los cuartos de doctores y enfermeras.
					
					Muy satisfecho de que el hospital haya sido construido confortable, dijo que le gustan todas las cosas y lo denomino como "Hospital de Estomatologia Ryugyong".
					
					Presento a los acompanantes y los funcionarios de salud publica las tareas concretas para terminar la construccion y operar bien el hospital.
					
					Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los constructores del hospital y los funcionarios de ramas correspondientes terminaran bien la edificacion del Hospital de Estomatologia Ryugyong, que sera inaugurado en ocasion del dia de fundacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea (10 de octubre), de modo que el pueblo se beneficie realmente de este centro asistencial.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a su par de Guinea-Bissau
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a su par de Guinea-Bissau
Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, remitio el dia 24 un mensaje de felicitacion a Manuel Siriho N'hamadjo, presidente de la Republica de Guinea-Bissau, con motivo del 40o aniversario de la proclamacion de la Republica.
					En su misiva, el remitente manifiesta su conviccion de que seguiran fortaleciendose y desarrollandose las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises con larga historia y le desea al destinatario exitos en su trabajo y a su pais la prosperidad.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de Consejo Mundial de Iglesias
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de Consejo Mundial de Iglesias
Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 24 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae, con la delegacion del Consejo Mundial de Iglesias encabezada por su secretario general Olav Fykse Tveit, que le hizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju visita IX Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju visita IX Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El primer ministro de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, visito el dia 24 la sede de la IX Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang. 
					Ahi se exhiben los productos metalurgicos, mecanicos, electronicos y quimicos, los articulos de industria ligera, alimentos y articulos de uso diario presentados por las companias de varios paises y regiones, entre otros, la RPDC, Alemania, Rusia, Malasia, Mongolia, Singapur, Italia, China, Cuba, Turquia y Taipei China. 
					
					Pasando revista a los tornos CNC, automoviles, tractores, azulejos de distintos tipos y otros productos hechos por los tecnicos y obreros coreanos y otros productos presentados por varios paises y regiones, el premier coreano subrayo la necesidad de producir mucho mas productos de gran reputacion popular y con competitividad mundial. 
					
					Apunto que la presente feria sera una buena ocasion para fomentar la amistad y solidaridad entre los paises y ampliar los negocios economicos y comerciales multifaceticos, la propaganda de mercancias y el intercambio cientifico-tecnico.

articles.title: Amistad caracteriza Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Amistad caracteriza Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tiene lugar del dia 23 en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones la Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang.
					Segun Pak Ung Sik, director de la Agencia de Exposiciones Internacionales de Corea, la presente feria es una buena oportunidad para promover la amistad y la unidad entre los paises y dinamizar el amplio y multilateral negocio economico y comercial, la propaganda de mercancias, el intercambio cientifico-tecnico.
					
					En la ocasion participan mas de 220 companias comerciales provenientes de mas de 10 paises y regiones, inclusive la RPDC.
					
					Toman parte muchas companias limitadas chinas de Beijing, Dandong, Dalian y Shenyang.
					
					Popov Sergei, director comercial de la compania de confites de territorio litoral de Rusia dijo estar muy contento de su asistencia a la feria. Espero que los productos de su compania le gusten mucho al pueblo coreano y deseo el desarrollo de colaboracion economica entre ambos paises.
					
					Juana Navarrete Mendoza, directora de comunicacion institucional de LABIOFAM S. A. de Cuba, dijo que vino aqui porque considero importante y excelente esta feria ya que son amistosas las relaciones Cuba-Corea desde hace mucho tiempo.
					
					Prosiguio que presento en la ocasion los productos importantes de su firma y esta orgullosa de la invitacion recibida.
					
					En la feria se exhiben mas de 57 mil mercancias de mas de 2 mil 400 variedades presentadas por las corporaciones comerciales de varios paises, tales como equipos mecanicos, productos electricos y electronicos, articulos de industria ligera, alimentos, aparatos medicos, medicamentos, materiales de construccion y productos quimicos y los medios de transporte.

articles.title: ACNC enumera hazanas de Kim Jong Il por la amistad Corea-Rusia
articles.content:
ACNC enumera hazanas de Kim Jong Il por la amistad Corea-Rusia
Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la linea ferroviaria Rajin-Jasan que permite a Corea y Rusia ampliar y desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion de acuerdo con los intereses comunes de ambos pueblos. 
					Ella es el fruto de la amistad y cooperacion Corea-Rusia preparado segun la Declaracion Corea-Rusia de Moscu firmada en 2001 por el Generalisimo Kim Jong Il y el presidente ruso V. V. Putin. 
					
					Viendo ese simbolo de amistad Corea-Rusia, el pueblo coreano recuerda con emocion las actividades exteriores del Generalisimo quien hizo ingentes esfuerzos por el desarrollo de las relaciones Corea-Rusia. 
					
					El sento la base de eterna duracion para ampliar y desarrollar esos lazos de larga historia conforme a las demandas de la epoca en cambio. 
					
					Por su energica guia, quedo firmado en febrero de 2000 el tratado de amistad, buena vecindad y cooperacion entre los gobiernos de ambos paises.
					
					En julio de 2000, por la invitacion del Generalisimo, Putin visito la RPDC como primera visita de un jefe de Estado ruso y durante su estancia aqui fue aprobada la Declaracion Conjunta Corea-Rusia.
					
					En 2002 y en 2011, ultimo ano de su vida, Kim Jong Il volvio a visitar Rusia y abrio las perspectivas de fortalecer las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-Rusia segun el tratado y declaraciones aprobados ya entre los dos paises. 
					
					Los lideres de ambos paises afirmaron que el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-Rusia conviene a los intereses fundamentales de ambos pueblos y hace gran aporte a la paz y seguridad de Asia y el resto del mundo. 
					
					Ratificaron que el problema de reunificacion de Corea debe ser resuelto de manera independiente y pacifica con la fuerza propia de la nacion coreana y que la retirada de las tropas norteamericanas del suelo surcoreano es impostergable para la preservacion de la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana y del Nordeste Asiatico. 
					
					Se comprometieron a que los dos paises contribuyan a mantener la estabilidad estrategica mundial y formar una nueva y justa estructura mundial en el principio de igualdad, respeto y cooperacion de beneficios mutuos. 
					
					Las historicas declaraciones conjuntas sirven de jalon para el desarrollo de amistad y cooperacion Corea-Rusia y gran guia por la paz y la seguridad del mundo. 
					
					Las visitas del Dirigente a Rusia y la aprobacion de aquellas declaraciones demuestran su historica proeza realizada por la amistad Corea-Rusia y por la causa de construccion de un nuevo mundo justo y la paz de la humanidad. 
					
					El Generalisimo condujo sabiamente para que las relaciones bilaterales se ampliaran y se desarrollaran cada dia mas segun el espiritu de la Declaracion Conjunta Corea-Rusia y la Declaracion Corea-Rusia de Moscu. 
					
					Corea y Rusia estrecharon el sentimiento y lazos de amistad activando la cooperacion y el intercambio en varios dominios como la economia, la cultura, la educacion, la ciencia y tecnica. 
					
					Hoy dia, continua la historia de amistad Corea-Rusia bajo la sabia orientacion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					El pueblo coreano consolidara y glorificara las imborrables proezas del Dirigente por la amistad Corea-Rusia y contribuira al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y a la preservacion de la paz y seguridad del mundo.

articles.title: ACNC comenta teoria de EE.UU. sobre "amenaza de misiles del Norte de Corea"
articles.content:
ACNC comenta teoria de EE.UU. sobre "amenaza de misiles del Norte de Corea"
Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Estados Unidos da mas acicate al establecimiento del sistema de defensa antimisil en la region de Asia-Pacifico.
					Como parte de ello, volvio a ejecutar recientemente la prueba de interceptacion de misiles en las islas Marshallese bajo el pretexto de hacer frente a la "amenaza de misiles del Norte de Corea".
					
					Este movimiento militar partio de su malsano intento de mantener a rayas a China y Rusia, potencias nucleares de Asia-Pacifico, y mantener y afianzar su hegemonia militar.
					
					La reciente prueba causa gran preocupacion de los paises asiaticos porque se realizo despues del establecimiento en la isla Guam del nuevo sistema de defensa antimisil.
					
					La ampliacion de la red antimisil de EE.UU. levanta la seria repulsion y vigilancia siendo calificada de llegada de nueva guerra fria en la region.
					
					Es que constituye un acto peligroso que busca la nueva epoca de confrontacion y carrera armamentista no solo en la region sino en la palestra internacional.
					
					Las teorias sobre la "amenaza", presentadas historicamente por el imperio, no fueron mas que una justificacion para defender sus actos de agresion e intervencion.
					
					Despues de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, el imperio persiguio obstinadamente la estrategia de nueva guerra fria basada en el campo antisovietico y anticomunista bajo el pretexto de prevenir la "proliferacion del comunismo".
					
					Terminada la guerra fria, EE.UU. preconizaba el mundo unipolarizado proclamandose como "unica superpotencia". Despues ejecuto la "guerra antiterrorista" bajo el vistoso rotulo de eliminar las "amenazas del terrorismo".
					
					Cuando el prepotente imperio fue agobiado por las enormes deudas estatales y la decadencia economica como consecuencias de la "guerra antiterrorista", la region de Asia-Pacifico emergio bruscamente como centro de desarrollo mundial del siglo XXI.
					
					Atemorizado ante el crecimiento de esa region con abundantes recursos naturales y mercados, donde habita casi la mitad de la poblacion mundial y estan concentrados las potencias nucleares y economicas y nuevos paises con grandes capacidades economicas, EE.UU. presento la llamada estrategia de dar importancia a Asia-Pacifico.
					
					Para realizar su nueva estrategia de hegemonia, procedio a la formacion del cerco definiendo a los paises rivales y "estados amenazantes" al igual que en el periodo de la Guerra Fria.
					
					Tomando en cuenta el fracaso de la estrategia de mundo unipolarizado, la estructura de fuerzas cambiada con la tendencia de multipolarizacion mundial y la repulsion internacional, comenzo a usar la expresion de "rivales potenciales" en alusion a China y Rusia.
					
					Para disuadirlos, el imperio promueve la formacion del sistema antimisiles desde Alaska, Sur de Corea, Japon y Filipinas hasta Australia.
					
					Engana a la sociedad internacional con el embuste de que ese sistema no toma en consideracion a las potencias del contorno sino para "hacer frente al desarrollo de misiles por el Norte de Corea".
					
					The Washington Post revelo que la Agencia Central de Inteligencia de EE.UU. ha definido ya en la decada de 1990 a China y Rusia como sus "rivales potenciales" y la RPDC e Iran fueron incluidos en la lista de "Estados amenazantes" porque se necesitaba la justificacion de establecer el sistema de defensa antimisil en Asia.
					
					El ex jefe del estado mayor general de las fuerzas coheteriles estrategicas de Rusia senalo que es asimetrica la reaccion del imperio contra la RPDC, especificando que el primero establece la red antimisil para disuadir la potencialidad nuclear de Rusia y China.
					
					Con el funcionamiento del nuevo sistema de defensa antimisil, el imperio trata de presionar militarmente a esos paises y al mismo tiempo, involucrarlos en la nueva carrera armamentista que conducira al desgaste de la fuerza nacional y al disturbio economico.
					
					Asi la teoria sobre la "amenaza de misiles del Norte de Corea" es un chisme para encubrir el caracter criminal de la nueva estrategia de hegemonia mundial y la de guerra fria de version asiatica.
					
					No se puede tolerar jamas el intento del imperio de convertir la region de Asia-Pacifico aspirante a la paz y al desarrollo en la cabeza de puente hacia la hegemonia mundial y en el teatro de nueva guerra fria.
					
					Esta condenado al fracaso el intento anacronico de EE.UU.
